intro: Arachnites bombyliflorus, commonly known as the common mouse-ear hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has small, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its botanical features make it a common and widespread species in temperate regions.
